intro: Nania glabrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf nania, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, often in shades of pink or violet. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
